greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period of the Fibonacci 3-step sequence A000073 mod prime(n).
comment: This sequence differs from the corresponding Lucas sequence (A106294) at n=1 and 5 because these correspond to the primes 2 and 11, which are the prime factors of -44, the discriminant of the characteristic polynomial x^3-x^2-x-1. We have a(n) < prime(n) for the primes in A106279.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Fibonacci n-Step
mathematica: n=3; Table[p=Prime[i]; a=Join[{1},Table[0,{n-1}]]; a=Mod[a,p]; a0=a; k=0; While[k++; s=Mod[Plus@@a, p]; a=RotateLeft[a]; a[[n]]=s; a!=a0]; k, {i,60}]
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, May 02 2005, Sep 18 2008
